title: Advanced Passive and Causative Structures
description: Mastering complex passive constructions and causative forms

sections.title: Complex Passive Constructions
sections.explanation: Advanced passive forms for reporting and distancing in academic and professional contexts.

patterns.name: Impersonal passive with reporting verbs
examples: It is widely acknowledged that climate change poses existential risks.
It has been suggested that the methodology requires revision.
It was initially believed that the species was extinct.
patterns.function: Introduces information without attributing to specific source

patterns.name: Subject-to-subject raising passive
examples: The policy is expected to reduce emissions by 40%.
The economy is forecast to grow by 3%.
The results are thought to support the hypothesis.

patterns.name: Past participle reporting
examples: Believed to be the oldest specimen...
Said to have originated in Asia...
Reported to cause significant side effects...

sections.title: Causative Structures
sections.explanation: Expressing that someone causes something to happen or be done.

patterns.name: Have something done
examples: We had the contract reviewed by legal counsel.
She's having her thesis proofread before submission.

patterns.name: Get something done
examples: I need to get this proposal approved by Friday.
How did you get your paper published so quickly?
patterns.function: Less formal, implies effort or achievement

patterns.name: Have/Get someone do something
examples: I'll have my assistant send you the files. (have + bare infinitive)
Can you get the IT department to fix this? (get + to-infinitive)

patterns.name: Make/Let someone do something
examples: The evidence made me reconsider my position.
The professor let students choose their own topics.

sections.title: Passive with Modal Verbs
sections.explanation: Complex modal passive constructions for speculative and hypothetical meanings.

patterns.example: The results could be influenced by sample size.
The data may have been compromised during transfer.
The error must be caused by corrupted input.
The document must have been deleted accidentally.

exercises.original: Scientists believe that the universe is expanding.
exercises.answer: It is believed that the universe is expanding.

exercises.sentence: The CEO _____ (the board/approve) the restructuring plan.
exercises.answer: had the board approve / got the board to approve

exercises.situation: Someone possibly leaked the confidential information.
exercises.answer: The confidential information may/might have been leaked.
